It operates On-Demand passenger services in the [[South (US)|Southeast]], [[Florida]], the [[Caribbean]] and, the [[Bahamas]]. YAT grew from a small operation out of Pompano Beach to a fleet of 4 Cessna 402Cs, all painted in yellow with a white/black checkerboard tail. The carrier had some issues with the US DOT, bordering on offering scheduled service as a charter airline.see U.S. DOT docket OST-2005-20077 Once legal to fly more than 4 flights a week, YAT expanded to Naples & Key West, along with offering 3 flights a day to Marsh Harbour & Treasure Cay from Ft. Lauderdale. Miami service was attempted in 2009. YAT started being affected by the high-seasonality of both the Florida Keys & Bahamas and the carrier relinquished their scheduled authority in 2009. Sorry they did not relinquish their authority. They were stripped of the scheduled authority by the FAA. Yellow Air Taxi is currently out of business they are not operating at all.
